metadata.name: New Root Certificate Installed Via Certutil.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects execution of "certutil" with the "addstore" flag in order to install a new certificate on the system. Adversaries may install a root certificate on a compromised system to avoid warnings when connecting to adversary controlled web servers.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\certutil.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('certutil.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-addstore')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/addstore')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('–addstore')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('—addstore')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('―addstore'))) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('root')))

output.summary: Detects execution of "certutil" with the "addstore" flag in order to install a new certificate on the system. Adversaries may install a root certificate on a compromised system to avoid warnings when connecting to adversary controlled web servers.

metadata.objective: False positive: Help Desk or IT may need to manually add a corporate Root CA on occasion. Need to test if GPO push doesn't trigger FP Reference: https://github.com/redcanaryco/atomic-red-team/blob/f339e7da7d05f6057fdfcdd3742bfcf365fee2a9/atomics/T1553.004/T1553.004.md
